news.title: West Bengal government eases circle rates in select areas of Kolkata
news.para: West Bengal government has rationalised circle rates in Kolkata, Salt Lake, and New Town, responding to Credai's concerns. An earlier 80-90% hike had sharply increased homebuyers' stamp duty burden, with rates often exceeding market prices. Key areas like Bonhooghly and Mahishbathan have seen significant reductions, bringing valuations to a more reasonable level.

news.title: ED questions actor Jagapathi Babu in connection with Sahiti Infra case
news.para: ED questioned actor Jagapathi Babu in the Sahiti Infra case, finding his dealings legitimate. The agency's prosecution complaint details how Sahiti Infratech, promoted by Boodati Lakshminarayana, duped homebuyers of ₹853 crore by diverting funds, including ₹214 crore in cash, into promoters' personal accounts, evidencing a criminal conspiracy.

news.title: Ventive Hospitality plans to acquire 76% stake in Hilton Goa owner Soham Leisure
news.para: Pune-based Ventive Hospitality plans to acquire a 76% stake in Soham Leisure Ventures, owner of the 104-key Hilton Goa Resort and a 4-acre land parcel, for Rs 320 crore. This move aims to double Ventive's room portfolio and enter the Goa leisure market, with an initial Rs 120 crore outlay for the resort and villa development.

news.title: Indore administration orders FIRs against developers of 16 illegal colonies
news.para: Indore administration has ordered the filing of FIRs against developers of 16 newly identified illegal colonies, bringing the total to 89 such cases. These 16 colonies, comprising 300 plots, were developed without necessary government permissions. This action aims to deter unlawful construction, protect potential buyers, and ensure planned urban growth in the region.

news.title: Ahmedabad civic body issues notices to 385 paying guest facilities without NOCs
news.para: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation is actively identifying and issuing notices to unauthorized paying guest facilities operating from residential buildings. So far, 385 out of 401 identified PGs lacking society and police NOCs have received notices, with warnings of sealing for non-compliance.

news.title: Lucknow: New commercial, residential plots to come up in Basantkunj scheme
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority will develop new commercial and residential plots in Basantkunj. Vacant land near green belts and residential areas will be planned. Vice-chairman Prathmesh Kumar inspected the scheme, ordering suspensions for negligence. A contractor faced a penalty for delay. An enforcement campaign will target unauthorised constructions. Development and beautification works are ongoing.

news.title: Maharashtra proposes to open up 16-acre Worli Dairy land for commercial use
news.para: Maharashtra's government proposes converting the 16-acre Worli Dairy land into a commercial zone, replacing its earlier reservation for a marine research institute and aquarium. This follows MMRDA's advocacy for mixed-use development. Public objections are now invited on this significant land-use modification within one month.

news.title: TCP changes zone of one lakh sq meter from green land to settlement across Goa
news.para: Goa's TCP department cleared numerous zone change proposals, converting 98,058sqm of green cover, including orchards, cultivable land, and no-development slopes, into settlement zones. Major developers and individuals secured these approvals, often pending clearances from water resources and forest departments, impacting villages across Pernem, Bardez, and Tiswadi.

news.title: Pune: Lokmanyanagar residents split on cluster development plan
news.para: Lokmanyanagar residents are sharply divided over a proposed cluster development plan for their aging Pune neighbourhood. While one group, backed by MLA Hemant Rasane, champions the project for holistic infrastructure upgrades and modern amenities, another fears it will derail ongoing individual redevelopments, wasting significant time and investment.

news.title: Income tax survey on Raymond's realty arm
news.para: The Income Tax department is conducting a survey action on entities linked to the Raymond group, specifically targeting its real estate business. This action, which began on Thursday and continued Friday, is limited to official premises. Raymond has confirmed the proceedings under Section 133A and is fully cooperating with authorities.

news.title: Delhi civic body extends property tax amnesty scheme by three months with late fee clause
news.para: The MCD extended its SUNIYO 2025-26 property tax amnesty scheme until December 31, adding a 2% late fee for payments after September 30. The scheme has attracted 1.16 lakh taxpayers, generating Rs 370.27 crore, and contributing to a 22.5% overall revenue rise.

news.title: SC holds tenant guilty of contempt, sends him to prison for not vacating premises
news.para: The Supreme Court held two individuals guilty of contempt for willfully disobeying an order to vacate their rental premises in Saharanpur. One contemnor was sentenced to three months' civil imprisonment and a Rs 1 lakh fine, while the other received a Rs 50,000 fine. Both face additional prison time if their fines are not paid within two months.

news.title: Maharashtra government to open tenders for 98 years' lease of ST Bus Depots
news.para: Maharashtra will lease MSRTC bus depots for 98 years to develop them as "Bus Ports," utilizing 13,000 acres of land. This, along with upcoming Pod Taxi services and major infrastructure projects like Metro expansion and new airports, is projected to fuel an unprecedented 15% growth in the real estate sector.

news.title: Nashik: Land records department to conduct ‘Bhumi Adalat’
news.para: The land records department will conduct a 'Bhumi Adalat' on October 1st at the division level to amicably resolve land disputes. This initiative aims to counsel parties on issues like mutation entries and land measurement, which often stem from personal fights or lack of awareness. Officials hope to prevent farmers from incurring irreparable damage due to prolonged litigation.

news.title: Kartik Aaryan, parents buy office space worth ₹13 crore in Mumbai
news.para: Kartik Aaryan, alongside his parents, has purchased an office space in Signature by Lotus, Andheri West, Mumbai, for ₹13 crore. The 1,905 sq ft property, which includes three car parking spaces, was registered in September 2025. This transaction incurred a stamp duty of ₹78 lakh and registration charges of ₹30,000.

news.title: Ludhiana suvidha kendras to remain open on weekend for property tax payment
news.para: Ludhiana's MC Suvidha Kendras will operate this weekend to help residents secure a 10% rebate on property tax for the 2025-26 financial year, available until September 30. Officials encourage online payments via mcludhiana.gov.in to avoid queues and benefit from the discount, as penalties will be imposed starting October 1.

news.title: Lucknow development body to e-auction Sahara Bazaar Complex on November 10
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority will e-auction the Sahara Bazaar Complex on November 10. The complex covers 4,741 square meters and houses 150 shops. Its lease expired in 2017. LDA cancelled the lease and took possession in June. The reserve price will be revised due to circle rate increases. The bidder can redevelop the site. The land will be freehold.

news.title: Three land officials behind 254 fraudulent registries in Gurugram's Farrukhnagar
news.para: A probe uncovered that two tehsildars and a naib tehsildar in Farrukhanagar allegedly facilitated 254 fraudulent land registries over four months, converting agricultural land into urban plots and authorizing illegal colonies. The officials manipulated property IDs and used forged documents, potentially costing the state exchequer crores. An investigation is underway in other tehsils as well.

news.title: Nashik: Land records department to conduct ‘Bhumi Adalat’
news.para: The land records department in Nashik division is set to conduct a 'Bhumi Adalat' on October 1st to resolve land disputes amicably. Deputy Director Mahesh Ingale aims to counsel complainants and respondents, addressing issues like mutation entries and land measurements.
